result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel M. Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. May not have contact with Todd L, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel M. Rodriguez

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
4:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Angel M. Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Angel M. Rodriguez. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF371/22CF614. Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

22CF371: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2-3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 & 4 are dismissed and read in. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions - consecutive to Case 22CF614. No contact with Todd L.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. No restitution requested.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.

22CF614: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed and read in. PSI waived and sentencing arguments heard. Court imposes total sentence  5 years WSP; 2 years IC w/credit for 201 days served, 3 years extended supervision w/ conditions; No contact with Todd L.. Defendant is not eligible for SAP/CIP. Court costs ordered. Defendant to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge. 

Certified copy of minutes given to KSD deputy.
Elements of charges for which defendant is pleading guilty filed by Defense Counsel T. Young

ADDRESS INFO for Angel M. Rodriguez

Prior: 5711 7th Avenue #203, Kenosha, WI 53140

08:58 AM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Angel M. Rodriguez, appeared in custody with Attorney Toni L. Young.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF371/22CF614. Bond motion filed in Case 22CF614 by Attorney Young. Arugments heard; The State objects. For reasons set forth on the record Court will deny the bond motion. Attorney Young is requesting an adjournment. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Moved.  Unable to forward.  Notice of Assignment of Judge returned by post office.
Notice of assignment of judge returned.   Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
to Modify Bond filed by Attny T. Young

Defendant Angel M. Rodriguez appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:36 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts

DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
